original_title: Sri Lanka Seylan bank Net up 5.8-pct in March quarter
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Profits at Sri Lanka’s Seylan Bank Plc group grew 5.83 percent to 1.02 billion rupees in the March, 2023 quarter, interim accounts showed.
The group reported earnings of 1.57 rupees for the quarter, and the shares were trading 1.67 percent down at 29/5 rupees.

Interest income grew by a fast 116.94 percent to 28.8 billion during the quarter and interest expenses grew 171.37 percent to 17.4 billion rupees resulting a 66.4 percent increase in Net Interest income to 11.5 billion rupees.
Trading gains fell 101.13 percent to 40 million rupees from the same quarter last year.

The Bank increased the impairment provision to capture the impact on emerging global and local economic challenges and the credit risk profile of the customers and continuously assesses the credit quality of the Bank’s loan portfolio in order to ensure adequate provisions are recognized in the financial statements.
Loans fell 4.56 percent to 423.9 billion rupees in March,2023 from 444.2 billion from the last quarter.
Provisions for bad loans increased by 88.14 percent to 6.3 billion rupees.
Stage 3 accumulated impairments rose to 43.6 billion rupees from 33.6 billion rupees from the last quarter.
At bank level gross non-performing loans were at 4.98 percent in March from 3.64 percent a year ago.
Tier 1 capital was 11.17 percent, up from 10.69 percent but above the required level. Total capital adequacy was 13.92 percent up from 13.59 percent, above the required level. (Colombo/May 02/2023)
